attributes.action: recall the events that led up to the death of Baby P, Khyra Ishaq, and Victoria Climbie’s and many, many others.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
All were high profile cases; all were avoidable tragedies. Although all appear outwardly different they all share the common thread of secret hearings and secret courts closed to the press and public.

Suppressing news is suppressing justice. 

Baby P, Khyra Ishaq, and Victoria Climbie had to be exceptional to break through the wall of silence.
 
No father or mother likes to see their child cruelly taken from them, be it by death or the courts.

Secrecy lowers the standard of the professionals. The children of the UK deserve the higher standards that openness would in fact bring.

We therefore ask you to embrace Lord Denning’s view that it is the judge and
court professionals who are as much on trial as any defendant and allow the
Clayton v Clayton verdict to stand.

rejection.details: Please rephrase the title of your petition to make it a clear call for action.
reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
